June 1928.THIS Report gives a summary of the recently published returns of unemployment in the various industries. In Table (A) is shown the course of unemployment during June, while Table (B) gives an analysis of the number of persons on the registers of Employment Exchanges in Great Britain at the 25th June, 1928.(A.) Unemployment in Insured Industries.The latest date for which unemployment figures by industries are available is the 25th June, 1928, at which date, the percentage unemployed in Great Britain and Northern Ireland was 10'8, as compared with 9'9 at the 21st May, 1928, with 8-8 at the 20th June, 1927, and with 14-6* at the 21st June, 1926. (D.) Latest Figures.The latest figure of unemployment available is that for the 16th July, 1928, giving a total number on the registers for Great Britain of 1,247,400. This is an increase over the position on the 25th June amounting to 54,836, and an increase over a year ago of 199,444. -' ARTHUR STEEL-MAITLAND.Ministry of Labour,July 23, 1928.
